Package edu.uky.games.physics_game.physics

Class Vector

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.games.physics_game.physics.Vector
public class Vector extends Object
A vector in a 2 dimensional space is composed of two numbers: an X value and a Y value. A vector can express the slope of a line (direction) as well as the length of a line segment (magnitude). Because it is simply a pair of numbers, it can also represent a point in 2D space. In this game, this class is used interchangeably to represent vectors and points.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

      public void divide(double scalar)
      Modifies this vector by dividing both components by a scalar value. Uses Utilities.safeDivide(double, double) to ensure there are no divide by zero errors.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the scalar divisor

    • scaleXto

      public void scaleXto(double x)
      Scale this vector so that it's x component is equal to some given number. The sign of the argument is ignored. In other words, this method will not change the direction of a vector, only its scale.
      Parameters:
      x - the number that this vector's x component will be after it has been scaled (sign ignored)

    • scaleYto

      public void scaleYto(double y)
      Scale this vector so that it's y component is equal to some given number. The sign of the argument is ignored. In other words, this method will not change the direction of a vector, only its scale.
      Parameters:
      y - the number that this vector's y component will be after it has been scaled (sign ignored)

    • normalize

      public void normalize()
      Scale this vector so that it's magnitude is 1.
